name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: I fully support the work of the Select Committee on the January 6th Attack on the Capitol to shed light on the truth, hold all responsible for the attack accountable, and prevent any such act from ever happening again.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: The attempt by former President Trump to subvert our democracy by propagating the big lie that he won the election and inciting a violent mob to overthrow the certification of election results cannot go unpunished.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: who were put in a grave position yet fought with everything they had to protect those inside the Capitol and the very foundation of our democracy.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: As someone who was at the Capitol on January 6th, let me say that we all owe a great amount of debt to the Capitol Police and surrounding law enforcement officers

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: January 6th, 2021 will forever go down as one of the darkest days in our history. On this solemn anniversary, my heart is with all who bore witness to the horrific scene that day—members of Congress, staff, employees, and every American who watched in shock on the news. (THREAD)

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text:
#Jan6th, will go down as one of the darkest days in our history.

On that painful day we remember the Capitol Police who fought to protect the foundation of our democracy.

Today as we all relive the trauma, know you're not alone & we must work to ensure this never happens again.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: A once in a generation infrastructure plan must address the needs of residents living in NYCHA and all public housing authorities nationwide.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: That is why I have introduced HR 235, the Public Housing Emergency Response, that eliminates the capital backlog for Public Housing Authorities nationwide and must be included in the Build Back Better Plan.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: NYCHA residents suffer from a consistent lack of hot water, insufficient heat during the winter months, rodent and insect infestations, broken elevators, and widespread and recurring lead and mold problems.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: The estimated capital backlog of public housing authorities nationwide stands at $70 billion. In my home city of New York, estimated needs of the nation’s largest public housing authority—NYCHA--have ballooned to more than $40 Billion.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: Years of disinvestment has left our nation’s public housing system in a state of disrepair. While I appreciate @POTUS's inclusion of $40B to improve public housing infrastructure, it's a minimal investment that doesn’t meet the capital needs of housing authorities nationwide.

This agreement secures:
-Accelerated vaccine distribution
-Rent relief, food assistance, enhanced unemployment insurance & direct payments for Americans
-Strong support for small businesses

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: So, while I am disappointed in my Republican colleagues and recognize this bill is not ideal or as comprehensive as the Heroes Act—it will provide some much-needed relief to the American people until we can pass a more robust stimulus under the Biden Administration.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: And let me be clear—$600 in direct payments and an additional $300 per week in unemployment is not enough—in fact, it’s just half of the aid that we passed in the CARES Act.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: As shuttered venues like cultural institutions and movie theaters, that depend on large crowds to survive faced difficulties accessing PPP, this bill creates a new $15 billion dollar grant program to target these establishments that have experienced a dramatic decline in revenue.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: It'll address what we have been hearing on the ground from small businesses—the need for cash infusions through grants. By establishing new guardrails and allocating $20 billion to the EIDL grant program, we are targeting the hardest hit small businesses to receive these grants.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: Our @HouseSmallBiz team has put together a factsheet for more information on how the relief bill will help small businesses. https://t.co/CDGmNJhOuZ

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text:
It would also set-aside $15 billion for small community banks, small credit unions, and small agricultural
credit institutions; and $15 billion for mission-based community lenders like CDFIs, CDCs, MDIs and microloan intermediaries.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text:
It would also create two set-asides for small businesses borrowers with 10 or fewer employees and small
businesses in underserved areas for loans up to $250,000:
o $15 billion set-aside for initial PPP loans; and
o $25 billion set-aside for second PPP loans.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: This bill would ensure PPP funding is targeted to small businesses, not large publicly funded companies by preventing publicly traded companies from receiving PPP funds.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: My floor statement today in support of the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/tOBI0VK2Ze

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: This bill is not perfect, but it is necessary. It has important provisions that will help our city and the most vulnerable. I will vote yes. 12/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: For Puerto Rico this bill would provide $12 billion in direct assistance.11/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: It provides badly needed fiscal relief for hard hit states and localities. New York State will receive $34 billion in fiscal relief and the City will receive $17 billion.  An important start. 10/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: It also provides $10 billion in grants for #SmallBusinesses.  9/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: The bill sets aside 25% of existing funds – about $30 billion – to go firms with fewer than 10 employees – prioritizing some of our smallest businesses. 8/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: For #SmallBusinesses the bill improves #PPP. It allows a longer period for use of the loans, fixing the “eight week” issue we’ve heard about. 7/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: It sets forth a strategic plan for testing and contract tracing. Only with testing & tracing can we control this virus and, eventually, fully reopen our economy. 6/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: It includes hazard pay for essential workers on the front lines of this crisis. They are the true heroes of this crisis and the Heroes Act gives them fairer compensation & #PPE 5/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: Under the bill economic stimulus payments will now be available to those with Individual Taxpayer Identification Numbers (#ITIN), so that undocumented communities can receive these payments. This will also be retroactive. 4/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: It provides a second round of more substantial economic stimulus payments consisting of $1,200 per family member, and up to $6,000 per household to ease the financial burden that many are experiencing due to #COVID19. 3/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: The bill boosts funds for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (#SNAP) by 15%. In my district, I’ve seen lines at local food banks. Families need this assistance. 2/12

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: The #HeroesAct, the #coronavirus bill we are voting on today, contains several important priorities I fought for. While the bill could go further, I’m pleased with much of what we secured. 1/12

tweet_text: Our nation has more #COVID19 cases than any other. Scapegoating immigrants - rather than focusing on testing, ensuring everyone can access healthcare, and supporting our healthcare workers - does nothing to stop this virus, but is a dangerous distraction that may prolong it.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text:
The @NYCCHR reported a massive spike in anti-Asian discrimination in the past few months. We must work together to fight this virus, not allow it to divide us. If you see something, say something.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: Today I joined BK elected officials in writing the Governor calling for improvements to the #unemploymentclaims system. We asked for strengthening the 72-hour call back system, non-English resources, simpler forms, and waiver of work search requirements. NYers need help fast! #UI https://t.co/KouxBEwvZJ

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: Hoy en #PuertoRico doctores harán la primera transfusión de plasma convaleciente a un paciente de #COVID19. El hospital de @SJUCiudadPatria se unió a @MayoClinic para llevar a cabo este novel tratamiento. Mi agradecimento a los doctores en la isla por este trabajo vital. https://t.co/3u6VM3l7cJ

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text:
In #PuertoRico today doctors are experimenting with convalescent plasma treatment for #COVID19. San Juan's (@SJUCiudadPatria) hospital is partnering with @MayoClinic to explore this novel treatment. My thanks to doctors on the Island for this vital work.

https://t.co/fOeAKSNJdR

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: @genemarks @mcuban @marcorubio @stevenmnuchin1 @NYGovCuomo @johnkrasinski @KabbageInc Thank you @genemarks. Always appreciate your coverage of the small businesses that power our economy and who need our help now more than ever. Those entrepreneurs and their workers who are feeding us, keeping shelves stocked and providing essential services are the real heroes.

name: Rep. Nydia Velazquez
tweet_text: Sen. @marcorubio recently said the PPP program is not a Wall Street package. I agree. That’s why before we pour more taxpayer money into it, we need guardrails & transparency to protect #SmallBiz interests and stop loans from reaching big corporations. https://t.co/6Ag7Pp9tML
